alert.note: Alert for Bartholomew; Brown; Decatur; Hancock; Henry; Johnson; Marion; Morgan; Randolph; Rush; Shelby (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Shelby, southeastern Hancock, Rush, southern Randolph, southeastern Morgan, northern Decatur, northeastern Brown, Johnson, northwestern Bartholomew, southern Henry and southeastern Marion Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 645 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles south of Winchester to near Franklin. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of Shelby, southeastern Hancock, Rush, southern Randolph, southeastern Morgan, northern Decatur, northeastern Brown, Johnson, northwestern Bartholomew, southern Henry and southeastern Marion Counties, including the following locations... Greensboro, Peoga, Morgantown, Knightstown, Modoc, New Whiteland, Lynn, Geneva, Waldron and Spiceland. This includes the following highways... Interstate 65 between mile markers 74 and 99. Interstate 70 between mile markers 112 and 133. Interstate 74 between mile markers 101 and 129. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for east central Indiana.

area.areaDesc: Bartholomew; Brown; Decatur; Hancock; Henry; Johnson; Marion; Morgan; Randolph; Rush; Shelby
